Reason: The 'commit_failure_policy' configuration is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly impacts the behavior of the system in response to commit disk failures, leading to significant variations in system performance. The code snippet provided shows that the configuration determines actions such as stopping transports, terminating threads, killing the JVM, and handling commit log errors, all of which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. Depending on the chosen policy, the configuration can result in node shutdowns, JVM terminations, and commit log shutdowns, which have a notable impact on system performance at the system level.
